example.eg: Robert wanted to enter the competition, but the officials told him he didn't qualify.
example.egtrans: 罗伯特想去参赛，但官方人员说他不合格。

example.eg: The family received a letter saying they qualified for state benefits.  Jeremy has qualified for entry into one of the country's top schools.
example.egtrans: 那家人收到一封信，称他们有资格享受本州福利。杰里米有资格进入全国最顶尖的学校之一。

example.eg: Evelyn has qualified as a plumber.
example.egtrans: 伊芙琳已经能够胜任水管工的工作。

example.eg: Murray has qualified and will now go through to the next round.
example.egtrans: 默里已经通过资格赛，现在将进入下一轮比赛。

dsense.name: qualify for [sth]
dsense.guideword: (sport: be eligible to compete in) (体育比赛)

example.eg: In order to qualify for this race, you must be a member of a recognised sporting club.
example.egtrans: 你必须是受认可的运动俱乐部的成员，才有资格参加这次赛跑。

example.eg: William qualified his statement by saying that of course he didn't mean all women drivers.
Agnes qualified her claim with an admission that she did not know the exact statistics.
example.egtrans: 艾格尼斯修正了她的声明，承认自己不知道确切的数据。

example.eg: This course will qualify students for a career in marketing.
example.egtrans: 这堂课程会使学生们有资格从事营销行业工作。

example.eg: This course will qualify students to teach at secondary level.
example.egtrans: 这堂课程会使学生们有资格从事中学水平的教育工作。

example.eg: I think your years of experience as a mother qualify you to give her advice.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使…有资格做, 使…能胜任

example.eg: Adjectives are words that qualify nouns.

dsense.name: not qualify
dsense.guideword: (sport, competition: not reach the next stage) (运动项目、比赛等)

example.eg: He finished sixth and did not qualify for the finals.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不合格，没资格（进入下一轮比赛）

example.eg: Fill in our online form now to see if you qualify for a loan.
